problem.markdown:
Consider the following transition graph of a discrete Markov chain with four states, and answer the following questions.

>>a. What is \(P_{41}\)? << = 0.5 +- 2% [explanation] The probabilities of leaving state 1 must sum to 1, and therefore \(P_{41} = 1 - (0.3 + 0.2) = 0.5\). [explanation] >>b. If the system is in state 1 at time n, what is the probability it will be in state 2 at time n + 1?<< = 0.2 +- 2% [explanation] There is only one way to get to state 2 in one time step, and we simply take the probability of this path, 0.2. problem.p: Consider the following transition graph of a discrete Markov chain with four states, and answer the following questions.
problem.label: a. What is \(P_{41}\)?

div.p: The probabilities of leaving state 1 must sum to 1, and therefore \(P_{41} = 1 - (0.3 + 0.2) = 0.5\).

problem.label: b. If the system is in state 1 at time n, what is the probability it will be in state 2 at time n + 1?

div.p: There is only one way to get to state 2 in one time step, and we simply take the probability of this path, 0.2.
